image.altText: A white man in a dark blue suit jacket, button up shirt, black pants, walking along a public footpath.

props.synopsis: Former Yipirinya School principal Gavin Morris has been found guilty of aggravated assault against students, but questions have been raised about Morris's hiring and his suitability for the role.

title.children: Questions raised about Alice Springs principal's suitability after conviction

image.altText: Powerlines seen at dusk in Darwin.

props.synopsis: Territorians are being urged to prepare for the possibility of rolling blackouts over Christmas, after damaging winds from ex-Tropical Cyclone Fina forced the shutdown of the NT's main gas supply.

title.children: 'Don't want to alarm': Territorians told to prep for blackouts over Christmas

image.altText: An aerial view of a pool, shade sails and buildings among trees, with Uluru in the background.

props.synopsis: A deal for the sale of operations at Ayers Rock Resort, near Uluru, and the Mossman Gorge Cultural Centre, in Far North Queensland, is one step closer after the Indigenous Land and Sea Corporation reached an agreement with Journey Beyond, an Australian-based "experiential tourism" company owned by an American private equity firm.

title.children: Ayers Rock Resort operation being sold to US company

image.altText: White woman, black tshirt, sitting in a wheel chair, holding a orange spalding basketball in her hand, posing on a court.

props.synopsis: When Mellissa Dunn was starting her wheelchair basketball career in Darwin in the 1990s, she felt she had to do everything on her own. Three decades later, the silver-medallist Paralympian says the support now being offered to the next generation of para-athletes is "life-changing".

title.children: Paralympian returns to sport after 25 years to help next generation of athletes

image.altText: A river cuts through thick bushland and stretches to the horizon, the surface of the water reflects clouds in the blue sky.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained under Freedom of Information laws have revealed planned water extraction from the aquifer that feeds the Northern Territory's Roper River could lead to "bad years" for its fish populations.

title.children: Will a controversial water plan lead to 'bad years' for Roper River barra?

image.altText: Five people stand in on a green space holding the sports precinct plans and a soccer ball.

props.synopsis: The Gillen Oval Multi-Sport Precinct has been green-lit and could become a shopwindow for Indigenous soccer players, former Manchester United star and Danish international Jesper Olsen says.

title.children: $14.5m NT sports complex could showcase Indigenous soccer, Man United champ says

image.altText: Three young girls, with the middle one carrying a toddler.

props.synopsis: The stark beauty of Australia's protected APY Lands is alive with ancient songlines and culture. But Elders see a need for change to secure the future of today's children.

title.children: Rare look at family, country and culture on the remote APY Lands

image.altText: A profile image of Md Isfaqur Rahman wearing a white shirt, tie and jacket.

props.synopsis: A Tiwi Islands man who murdered 23-year-old Bangladeshi student Md Isfaqur Rahman during a Darwin home invasion in 2023 has been sentenced to life behind bars.

title.children: International student's killer sentenced to life behind bars

image.altText: A man being escorted through an airport by two police officers.

props.synopsis: Peter Scammell, who is facing a murder charge over the death of his partner Katrina Hawker five years ago, was granted bail just over 24 hours after being extradited from Victoria.

title.children: Man accused of partner's murder granted bail one day after extradition

image.altText: Backs of officials looking at burnt out ground with trainline in distance.

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns says it has been a "difficult 24 hours", with more than 20 fires still uncontained across the state. Follow live.

title.children: Fire jumps a kilometre over water, disaster declared for multiple NSW regions

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaking.

props.synopsis: The furore over Communications Minister Anika Wells's expenses continues, with just three days until the government's much-anticipated social media ban for under 16s comes into force.

title.children: PM's office approved almost $100k in flights for communications minister

image.altText: A female's hands operate a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Australia's social media age ban is one of the most significant attempts to rebalance the asymmetric power relationship between government and tech.

title.children: Parents could grant Labor the grace the opposition won't on social media ban

image.altText: Pro-choice protesters dressed as handmaidens outside the US Capitol

props.synopsis: In the wake of widespread abortion bans, US prosecutors launch hundreds of cases charging people with crimes related to their pregnancy, miscarriage, stillbirth or birth.

title.children: 'This was a wanted pregnancy': The mothers facing prosecution in Trump's America

image.altText: Trump furrows his brow as he enunciates a word, staring directly into a camera

props.synopsis: A Republican claimed a win at a by-election in Tennessee this week, but his party colleagues are sounding alarm bells.

title.children: This Tennessee election has set off alarm among Trump's Republicans

image.altText: Scott Boland celebrates a wicket while an England batter looks disappointed behind him

props.synopsis: Australia was patient, mature and ruthless on day three at the Gabba, widening the chasm between it and an England side now set for its day of reckoning.

title.children: England on the Ashes brink as Australia shows everything Bazball lacks

image.altText: A woman, her face obsucred, looks at a framed photograph of women and children in the desert

props.synopsis: In the 1960s, the last of the desert families were coming into contact with white people. For one woman, the moment was captured on camera.

title.children: Rare photo that captures 'first contact' between desert families and white Australia

image.altText: Thailand’s Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul

props.synopsis: Accused of incompetence and apathy in the aftermath of natural disasters, governments across Asia are facing increasing backlash as the impact of global warming intensifies.

title.children: A new storm is brewing in South-East Asia. This time it's in the halls of power

image.altText: A Latina woman with long brown hair and a guide dog walking across a crowded crossing

props.synopsis: Living with vision impairment throws up many challenges. Being Deaf on top of that requires you to go to even greater lengths just to fit in with the modern world. This is how one Deafblind woman does it.

title.children: Jael is Deaf and blind. Here's how she goes about her day

image.altText: A photo of Adam Watts in police uniform smiling alongside a  photo of a NSW Police logo.

props.synopsis: A former NSW Police officer with post-traumatic stress disorder had his mental health incorrectly challenged by a doctor who never consulted or examined him during a year-long battle with the force's insurer.

title.children: Officer's mental health questioned by insurance doctor he'd never met

image.altText: The signed entry of a building.

props.synopsis: For four decades Lagoon Restaurant has been one of Wollongong's most iconic and controversial establishments, enjoying a prime seaside location and a close relationship with the city's political class.

title.children: Illegal seafood and ALP fundraisers etched into iconic restaurant's fame

image.altText: A large amount of fire can be seen blasting from the end of a piece of Ukrainian artillery

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin this week claimed Moscow's biggest battlefield gain in close to two years: the Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk. Some experts don't believe him.

title.children: Why the small city of Pokrovsk means so much to Vladimir Putin

image.altText: Two people dressed in blue protective gear carrying out a stretcher with a body on it covered in a white sheet.

props.synopsis: Gunmen stormed a hostel in the early hours of the morning, shooting 25 people at the scene and killing at least 11 people, including three children.

title.children: At least 11 killed in South Africa hostel shooting

image.altText: New prep-aged children sit on floor in circle in prep classroom playing barrel of monkeys game at Spring Mountain State School.

props.synopsis: Parents had the opportunity to pore over NAPLAN results for their children's school this week, but interpreting the data may not have been clear at first glance.

title.children: Why you may want to take a closer look at a school's NAPLAN results

image.altText: A man in a dark dry suit floating with his head above water in a pool, in scuba diving gear.

props.synopsis: Open water divers say underwater visibility has improved and marine life is returning to some areas off South Australia's coast. Experts say it's a positive sign, but warn it's "way too early" to say the environment is recovering from the state's algal bloom.

title.children: Fish returning to some parts of SA's coast, divers say

image.altText: A white seagull with orange beak and legs, grey wings and black tail stands on bitumen.

props.synopsis: Pesky seagulls snatching food from unsuspecting members of the public has spurred a Melbourne council to start canine patrols of Federation Square.

title.children: Dog patrols at Federation Square to curb 'terrifying' seagull swooping

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Alright, show us what you've got. I'll keep my expectations low.

title.children: So, you think you're good at quizzes? It's time to play HARD!

image.altText: A high shot of beach cabanas set up near the water at Noosa beach

props.synopsis: First responders say they are having to live well outside their operating regions due to lack of available housing.

title.children: First responders struggling to find homes in tourism hotspot

image.altText: A man crouches in a paddock with cattle in the background.

props.synopsis: Queensland producers say a blanket approach to environmental laws will restrict their ability to manage land sustainably and responsibly.

title.children: Farmers feel 'forgotten' as environment, land clearing laws tightened

image.altText: Red and black flags with the acronym CMFEU flying in the wind.

props.synopsis: This week's public hearings centred on how a long-running bitter turf war escalated to the point a rival union boss sought help from the state's top cop.

title.children: Union 'turf war' dominates second week of Queensland CFMEU inquiry

image.altText: The top three F1 drivers in qualifying stand on the podium, with (left to right) Lando Norris, Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri.

props.synopsis: Aussie Oscar Piastri's hopes of the world F1 crown slump after title rivals Max Verstappen and Lando Norris finish ahead of him in Abu Dhabi GP qualifying.

title.children: 'I've got a chance': Piastri won't rule out F1 boilover despite tough qualifying

image.altText: Steve Smith, Mitchell Starc and Jofra Archer

props.synopsis: A sleepy Jofra Archer cops a rinsing from Matthew Hayden, as the English finally make it through the first over of an innings. Here are the quick hits from day three of the Gabba Ashes Test.

title.children: Five quick hits: The first 'English' wicket and Archer's 'shocking look'

image.altText: A picture of the golden FIFA World Cup trophy on a pedestal at a reception ahead of the World Cup draw.

props.synopsis: Australia's North American west coast adventure at the World Cup is confirmed, with matches in Vancouver, Seattle and Santa Clara in California.

title.children: Socceroos set for wild west North American adventure at World Cup 2026

image.altText: A car off the side of the road.

props.synopsis: Cyclone Joan made landfall near the WA mining town of Port Hedland a year after Cyclone Tracy flattened Darwin, and it was almost as powerful.

title.children: Cyclone Joan's fury remembered 50 years on

image.altText: A display monitor on the handlebars of an e-bike

props.synopsis: An e-bike will be top of their Christmas wish list this year, prompting a warning for parents to know the rules.

title.children: Parents urged to learn rules about e-bikes as Christmas approaches

image.altText: young boy playing on phone while laying on the couch

props.synopsis: These school holidays, children under 16 will find themselves with less social media access as a ban comes into place. We asked the experts how parents can best support their kids with the transition.

title.children: Gearing up for the school holidays? Here's how to survive them without social media
